      • playCAF

        public boolean playCAF(java.lang.String paramString1,
                       java.lang.String paramString2,
                       boolean paramBoolean)
        This method plays a CAF (Core Audio Format) file. CAF is a container for many differet audio formats, including MP3, FLAC, ACC, OGG and M4A
        Parameters:
        paramString1 - url an absolute location to the base location of the audio file
        paramString2 - songname This is the name of the song as gieven to the speaker, so that the speaker knows the name
        paramBoolean - @CARL I think this refers to playing but I'm not sure
        See Also:
        song will play on the speaker
        Carl's questions
        no idea what @return should be in this case. It seems to return some kind of boolean. Assumed yes it can play or no it can't

      • playCAFFromCertainTime

        public boolean playCAFFromCertainTime(java.lang.String paramString1,
                                      java.lang.String paramString2,
                                      int paramInt)
        This method plays a CAF file from a certain time after its start
        Parameters:
        paramString1 - url an absolute location to the base location of the audio file
        paramString2 - songname This is the name of the song as gieven to the speaker, so that the speaker knows the name
        paramInt - timeFromStart @CARD I think this is the time in milliseconds from the start of the file
        Returns:
        NO IDEA @CARL
        See Also:
        speaker will play a song from a particular time

      • pause

        public void pause()
        This method pauses the music. @CARL I have no idea what the difference between pause and stop is. Because there is no play method that does not take a parameter (as in no method for continue from pause)

      • playWAV

        public boolean playWAV(java.lang.String paramString)
        This method is designed for playing WAV files.
        Parameters:
        paramString - The location of the song relative to he base location of the file system
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether playing this was successful
        See Also:
        speaker will start playing the song

      • getPlayerState

        public HKPlayerState getPlayerState()
        Checks if the player is currently initializing, playing, preparing (@CARL What the does this mean), paused or stopped (@CARL again what is the difference if there is no play())
        Returns:
        One of the following states EPlayerState_Init, EPlayerState_Play, EPlayerState_Preparing, EPlayerState_Pause, EPlayerState_Stop
